other_tests.findings: Twin A had complex congenital heart disease. Twin B had dextrocardia and otherwise normal cardiac anatomy.
Twin A had single-ventricle physiology and chronic hypoxemic myocardium.
Hypoxemia in Twin A with oxygen saturation in the arm between 30% and 40%, and in the leg, it was 90%.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Saturation measurements fluctuated but indicated Twin Bâ€™s circulation was largely responsible for perfusion.

other_tests.findings: Twin A relied on Twin B for circulatory support; intraoperative challenges included managing shunting through the superior mesenteric artery.
other_tests.changes_over_time: During the operation, twin-to-twin shunting was observed, affecting oxygen saturation.
